overview: From 2025-09-18 to 2025-09-19, elizaos/eliza had 4 new PRs (0 merged), 1 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Provide an option for webhooks (Farcaster)
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
From Github:

The polling interval is either pretty expensive or bad UX. Looking for alternative options to initiate new messages via webhook. This can be an advanced option with polling remaining as the default (good exp for new devs). * Webhooks also introduce additional flexibility in the poll/fetch options (e.g. post a link or specific phrase or in a specific channel) without additional modifications to the plugin & config. Base neynar plan: 1M CU per month (10M at second tier)
Polling notifications: 300 CU

"Plugins can mount routes to the elizaos server and trigger stuff so possible to do webhooks without too much complexity" - Sayo

topPRs.title: fix(plugin-sql): standardize PGLite data directory environment variable
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Issue

This PR addresses inconsistent environment variable naming for PGLite data directory configuration across the codebase. Previously, the system used multiple environment variables (, ) which created confusion and maintenance overhead.

## Changes

- **Standardized environment variable**: Replace all instances of  and  with 
- **Updated examples**: Modified  to use the new environment variable
- **CLI updates**: Updated scenario isolation to use 
- **Plugin-sql refactoring**: Simplified configuration logic by removing deprecated fallbacks
- **Test updates**: Updated all tests to reflect the new environment variable naming
- **Code cleanup**: Minor formatting improvements (empty function bodies)

## Files Modified

- : Updated configuration and constants
- : Updated environment variable
- : Simplified configuration logic
- : Simplified configuration logic
- : Updated test cases
- : Updated test cases

## Benefits

- **Consistency**: Single, clear environment variable name across the entire codebase
- **Maintainability**: Reduced complexity by removing deprecated fallback logic
- **Documentation**: Clearer naming convention that explicitly indicates purpose
- **Testing**: Comprehensive test coverage for the new configuration

## Breaking Changes

⚠️ **Breaking Change**: Users currently using  or  environment variables will need to update their configuration to use  instead.

## Migration Guide

If you're currently using:
-  → Change to 
-  → Change to

topPRs.title: fix(cli): wait for port to be free before dev restart
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
This fixes the dev mode port increment loop by waiting for the previous server port to be released before restarting.

- Adds a small utility  using existing 
- Ensures we wait before starting the server after rebuild

Tested locally; the server no longer hops ports upon file change restarts.
